item.title: Report X-2024090620
item.description:
Report X-2024090620

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-07
  • City: WILLINGTON
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: PACKAGE WITH NO DOT LABEL WAS FOUND WET AND RIPPED OPEN. 1X1 FLUID GALLON REGULATED OLYMPIC PREP MAGIC PLASTIC BOTTLE BECAME CRUSHED DURING SHIPMENT AND CAUSED THE BOTTLE TO CRACK OPEN AND THE CONTENTS TO LEAK OUT CONTAMINATING THE REMAINING CONTENTS INSIDE

item.title: Report X-2024090332
item.description:
Report X-2024090332

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-10T09:23:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-03
  • City: WILLINGTON
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: This is an undeclared hazmat. The outer box has no markings on it. The box contains 12X4oz tubes of BioFreeze Professional Colorless Gel and 2X32oz bottles of Pro Advantage Isopropyl Rubbing Alcohol 70%. The SDS on these two items show that they should be regulated and the inner box that the BioFreeze is in has a limited quantity diamond on it. These items did not leak. A unregulated bottle of ProteX disinfectant has a crack in it and leaked in the box.
